narrative.narrative: Airlift International was a cargo airline based at Miami,FL,USA. It began in 1945 as Riddle Airlines, named after the founder John Paul Riddle. It did charters as well. In 1965 it was renamed to Airlift International. To start in 1945 it flew Curtiss C-46 Commandos and DC-4's and had a main route to San Juan,Puerto Rico. In 1951 it expanded service to New York and soon after to Chicago and Detroit. In 1960 it got two DC-7's which did charters to Europe and for the military. It then got Armstrong Whitworth Argosy 660's but those were replaced by DC-8 jets in 1963. It also used L-1049 Super Constellations,Canadair CL-44's,Lockheed Hercules,707-320's,and 727-100C's. In 1966 it bought much of Slick Airways, a California based cargo airline that had just ceased. It also did charters to South America. In 1981it went into Chapter 11 Bankruptcy and came out of it and kept using DC-8's but now used Fairchild F-27's and the stretched version the FH-227, American made versions of the Fokker F27 of the Netherlands. The airline ceased in June 1991.
